Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos of Corinthian type; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of siren to left (tip of wing and tail feathers with added red remaining); at right, tail feathers of bird to right; incised spoked rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.584.a,1888,0601.584.b, 1888,0601.584.c, 1888,0601.584.i, 1888,0601.584.e, 1888,0601.584.f, 1888,0601.584.g and 1888,0601.584.h. Beazley and Payne attributed British Museum 1888,0601.584.a to the Komast Group (Beazley and Payne 1929, 259, no. 18).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 360, no. B467)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 147, note 43, no. 25)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 228, no. 25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0334) (Phase 1)
